# The BrailleR package is a collection of tools to make use of R a happier experience for blind people.

BrailleR version numbers are of the form a.b.c, where a is the major
version b is the minor version, and c is the pactch version. From July
2023, the version number starts with a 1 because development over ten
years means we believe the package delivers on the original aims of the
BrailleR Project. The minor version is odd for development and even for
CRAN releases. Patch version increments just help track progress.

The BrailleR package does have dependencies, all of which are available
on CRAN.
[![Dependencies](https://tinyverse.netlify.com/badge/BrailleR)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=BrailleR)

[![Github
version](https://img.shields.io/badge/devel%20version-0.32.1-blue.svg)](https://github.com/ajrgodfrey/BrailleR)

[![Last commit
badge](https://img.shields.io/github/last-commit/ajrgodfrey/BrailleR.svg)](https://github.com/ajrgodfrey/BrailleR/commits/blue)

[![CRAN_Status_Badge](http://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/BrailleR)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=BrailleR)

[![CRAN
checks](https://badges.cranchecks.info/summary/BrailleR.svg)](https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/check_results_BrailleR.html)

[![Downloads per
month](http://cranlogs.r-pkg.org/badges/last-month/BrailleR?color=green)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=BrailleR)

[![Release
version](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/BrailleR?color=black)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=BrailleR)

[![R build
status](https://github.com/ajrgodfrey/BrailleR/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/ajrgodfrey/BrailleR/actions)

### Blind people’s use of R

Blind people cannot use RStudio and depending on the combination of
operating system and screen reading software we choose to use, we might
have differing levels of success with the standard R GUI.

R is perhaps the most blind-friendly statistical software option because
all scripts can be written in plain text, using the text editor a user
prefers, and all output can be saved in a wide range of file formats.
The advent of R markdown and other reproducible research techniques can
offer the blind user a degree of efficiency that is not offered in many
other statistical software options. In addition, the processed Rmd files
are usually HTML which are the best supported files in terms of screen
reader development.

### Specific objectives of BrailleR

1.  Make accessing output simpler.
2.  Gain access to the content depicted in a graph.
3.  Make it easier for blind users to create their own R markdown
    documents.
4.  Replace the tasks other users can do quickly using the RStudio IDE.

If these criteria are all met, then the `BrailleR` package can support
blind people through their first courses in statistics, and
perhaps/hopefully into second or third courses.

### Installation of BrailleR

Use the following commands if using the CRAN version of BrailleR:

    chooseCRANmirror(ind=1)
    install.packages("BrailleR")

Or, if the CRAN version is not recent enough or your liking:

    chooseCRANmirror(ind=1)
    install.packages("remotes")
    remotes::install_github("ajrgodfrey/BrailleR", upgrade=TRUE, quiet=TRUE)

### You can help

Any assistance to fill in the numerous gaps in what BrailleR delivers
will be most gratefully received. As the primary developer of this
package is himself blind, attempts to find out if the tools being
created actually do replace visual elements or tasks requires a sighted
person to sit alongside to offer commentary.

### Code of Conduct

Please note that this project is released with a [Contributor Code of
Conduct.](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/CONDUCT.md) By
participating in the BrailleR Project, you are agreeing to this code of
conduct. Please check you agree with its terms before participating.

### Wish list

Some issues to resolve:

1.  Get extra bits of information for WTF() coming through, such as
    other shapes, lines etc.
2.  ascertain which shiny app widgets are useful for blind users’ screen
    reading software.
3.  link various plot objects to sonify package.
4.  get more graphics ready for making into SVG for use on Tiger
    products; mostly in SVGThis() method
5.  Get more Graph types working with the additional XML to make them
    interactive.
6.  get graph files named properly by TwoFactors(); including boxplots
    etc vs each factor not both.
7.  In OneFactor() and TwoFactors(): ensure that boxplots are created
    for each factor unless a level is short of reps.
8.  WTF() doesn’t pick up multiple outliers in boxplot() as more than
    one point
9.  fix VI.lm to cater for the weighted lm case.
10. check the css is working for VI.lm()
11. work out how to change colours in R console for low vision users as
    commands and/or settings
12. create function to re-create vignettes from Rnw source into HTML
13. Multiple language support was started but is in serious need of some
    love.
14. Functions for the VI method to be completed include: VI.prcomp(),
    VI.factanal(), VI.glm(), VI.htest()?

# Package index

## Explore Graphs

Explore ggplot graphs in accessible ways.

- [`VI()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/VI.md) :
  Extract information from a graphical object
- [`sort(`*`<VIgraph>`*`)`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/sort.VIgraph.md)
  : Sort VI.ggplot points list
- [`grep(`*`<VIgraph>`*`)`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/grep.VIgraph.md)
  [`gsub(`*`<VIgraph>`*`)`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/grep.VIgraph.md)
  : String manipulation of the output produced by VI.ggplot
- [`Describe()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Describe.md)
  : Describe method to help visualize plot types.
- [`MakeAccessibleSVG()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeAccessibleSVGMethod.md)
  : Create and display a accessible exploration webpage SVG of graph
- [`BrowseSVG()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrowseSVG.md)
  : Merge svg and xml file in html file
- [`SVGThis()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SVGThis.md)
  : Save commonly used graphs as structured SVG files.
- [`ViewSVG()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/ViewSVG.md)
  : Create the necessary files to allow interactive viewing of SVG
- [`AddXML()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/AddXMLMethod.md)
  : Create XML files to sit alongside SVG files in order to make an
  accessible graph experience.
- [`WTF()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WTF.md)
  [`wtf()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WTF.md) :
  What's this figure?
- [`summary(`*`<recordedplot>`*`)`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/summary.recordedplot.md)
  : Summarise the display list for a graphics device

## Graph and analysis shortcuts

Functions to help speed up graph making and analysis tasks

- [`boxplot()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/boxplot.md)
  : Create a standard boxplot with a few extra elements added to the
  output object
- [`dotplot()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/dotplot.md)
  : create a dotplot using stripchart
- [`hist()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/hist.md) :
  Create a standard histogram with a few extra elements added to the
  output object
- [`OneFactor()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/OneFactor.md)
  : Analysis for a continuous response for one group factor
- [`OnePredictor()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/OnePredictor.md)
  : Exploration of the relationship between a response and a single
  predictor
- [`ScatterPlot()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/ScatterPlot.md)
  [`FittedLinePlot()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/ScatterPlot.md)
  : Create a standard scatter plot with a few extra elements added to
  the output object
- [`ThreeFactors()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/ThreeFactors.md)
  : A convenience function for a Three-way analysis
- [`TimeSeriesPlot()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/TSPlot.md)
  : Create a standard time series plot with a few extra elements added
  to the output object
- [`TwoFactors()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/TwoFactors.md)
  : A convenience function for a two-way analysis
- [`UniDesc()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/UniDesc.md)
  : Descriptive statistics and graphs for univariate data
- [`WhereXY()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WhereXY.md)
  : Count points in a scatter plot

## Shortcuts / Macros

Other shortcut functions to speed up common task

- [`BrailleRHome()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`BrailleRInAction()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`LURN()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`Google()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`google()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`R4DS()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`r4ds()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  [`WriteRHome()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleRUsefulLinks.md)
  : Open the home page for the BrailleR Project, the Google search
  engine, the BrailleR in Action book, or the Let's Use R Now (LURN)
  book in your browser
- [`DataViewer()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/DataViewer.md)
  : Open a data object in your chosen spreadsheet software
- [`Premier100()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Embossers.md)
  : Prepare BrailleR settings for specific braille embossers
- [`FindReplace()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/FindReplace.md)
  [`Rnw2Rmd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/FindReplace.md)
  [`UseTemplate()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/FindReplace.md)
  [`UseTemplateList()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/FindReplace.md)
  : Find/Replace text in a file
- [`GetExampleText()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetExampleText.md)
  : extract the example text from a help page
- [`Get7zip()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetCygwin()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetPandoc()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetPython()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetPython3()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetRStudio()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetWriteR()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetWxPython()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  [`GetWxPython3()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetWriteR.md)
  : Download and install software (Windows users only)
- [`history()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/history.md)
  : View the history of the current workspace
- [`JoinBlindRUG()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/JoinBlindRUG.md)
  [`ThankYou()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/JoinBlindRUG.md)
  : Send an email based on a template
- [`MakeBatch()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeBatch.md)
  [`MakeAdminBatch()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeBatch.md)
  : Create batch files for processing R scripts and markdown files under
  Windows
- [`MakeReadable()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeReadable.md)
  : Convert line breaks in vignette documentation
- [`History2Rmd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  [`History2Qmd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  [`R2Rmd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  [`R2Qmd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  [`ProcessAllMd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  [`ProcessAllRmd()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  [`RemoveBOM()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRmdFiles.md)
  : Work flow convenience functions
- [`NewFunction()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/NewFunction.md)
  : Create a template for a new function
- [`Notepad()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/notepad.md)
  : Open standard Windows tools quickly
- [`PandocAll()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/PandocAll.md)
  : Convert files using pandoc.
- [`pdf2html()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/pdf2html.md)
  : Convert a pdf file to html
- [`txtStart()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/R2txtJG.md)
  [`txtOut()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/R2txtJG.md)
  [`txtStop()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/R2txtJG.md)
  [`txtComment()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/R2txtJG.md)
  [`txtSkip()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/R2txtJG.md)
  : Save a transcript of commands and/or output to a text file.
- [`Require()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Require.md)
  : Load a package by installing it if necessary
- [`ChooseEmbosser()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`ChooseStyle()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`ChooseSlideStyle()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`ResetDefaults()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetAuthor()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetBRLPointSize()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetPaperHeight()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetPaperWidth()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetLanguage()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetMakeUpper()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetPValDigits()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  [`SetSigLevel()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetOptions.md)
  : Functions for setting package options.
- [`SpellCheck()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SpellCheck.md)
  : A spell checking interface
- [`SpellCheckFiles()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SpellCheckFiles.md)
  [`print(`*`<wordlist>`*`)`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SpellCheckFiles.md)
  : Spell checking a file or all files within a specified folder
- [`UpdateGraph()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/UpdateGraph.md)
  [`Main()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/UpdateGraph.md)
  [`XLab()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/UpdateGraph.md)
  [`YLab()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/UpdateGraph.md)
  : extract or alter graph parameters
- [`CheckIt()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WhatIs.md)
  [`check_it()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WhatIs.md)
  [`what_is()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WhatIs.md)
  [`WhatIs()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WhatIs.md)
  : Investigate data objects
- [`WhichFile()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/WhichFile.md)
  : Find a text string in files
- [`AutoSpellCheck()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/AutoSpellCheck.md)
  : Automatic fixing of typos
- [`FindCSSFile()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Internal.md)
  [`InQuotes()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Internal.md)
  [`nNonMissing()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Internal.md)
  : Internal functions for the BrailleR package
- [`BRLThis()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BRLThis.md)
  : Convert a graph to a pdf ready for embossing
- [`CleanCSV()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/CleanCSV.md)
  : clean out unwanted white space from a csv file
- [`MakeAllFormats()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeAllFormats.md)
  : Prepare the options for conversion of an R markdown file.
- [`GetPython27()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`GetWxPython27()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`MakeAllInOneSlide()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`MakeSlidy()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`MakeSlideShow()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  : Deprecated functions
- [`VI.barplot`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.density`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.aovlist`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.Date`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.factor`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.glm`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.manova`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.mlm`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.stepfun`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  [`VI.table`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/unfinished.md)
  : Unfinished Methods to help vision impaired useRs
- [`GrabLast()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SessionLog.md)
  [`SessionLog()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SessionLog.md)
  [`ShowMe()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SessionLog.md)
  : Retrieve a copy of the console input/output

## BrailleR related

All other function not otherwise categorized

- [`BrailleR-package`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleR-package.md)
  [`BrailleR`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/BrailleR-package.md)
  : Improved Access for Blind Users
- [`SetupBrailleR()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetupBrailleR.md)
  [`MyBrailleR()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/SetupBrailleR.md)
  : Establish or open the BrailleR folder for the user
- [`GetGoing()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/GetGoing.md)
  : Set options for using BrailleR
- [`MakeRprofile()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/MakeRprofile.md)
  : Load BrailleR on Startup in Current Working Directory
- [`GoBlind()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`GoSighted()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`GoAdvanced()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`GoNovice()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`LatexOn()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`LatexOff()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`ViewOn()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  [`ViewOff()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Options.md)
  : Set package options
- [`WriteR()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/PrepareWriteR.md)
  [`TestPython()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/PrepareWriteR.md)
  [`TestWX()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/PrepareWriteR.md)
  [`PrepareWriteR()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/PrepareWriteR.md)
  : Getting started with WriteR
- [`GetPython27()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`GetWxPython27()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`MakeAllInOneSlide()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`MakeSlidy()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  [`MakeSlideShow()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/Deprecated.md)
  : Deprecated functions
- [`Augment()`](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/reference/AugmentMethod.md)
  : add additional detail to the stored object for a graph

# Articles

### Use BrailleR

- [Exploring
  Graphs](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/ExploringGraphs.md):
- [Getting started with the WriteR
  application](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/IntroWriteR.md):
- [History of the BrailleR
  package](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/BrailleRHistory.md):

### Examples

Various sets of example pages

- [The BrailleR package Example
  1](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/Ex1histograms.md):
- [The BrailleR package Example
  2](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/Ex2BasicNumerical.md):
- [The BrailleR package Example
  3](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/Ex3UnivariateDescription.md):
- [The BrailleR package Example
  4](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/Ex4SingleResponseOneGroupingFactor.md):
- [Exploring
  Graphs](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/ExploringGraphs.md):
- [Testing the VI.ggplot() within the BrailleR
  package"](http://ajrgodfrey.github.io/BrailleR/articles/qplot.md):
